title.narrative: 1.10 POLICY SUPPORT&EMERG. PREPAREDENESS

description.narrative: 1.10 Health, nutrition, Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) and HIV/AIDS policy framework and strategies for children and women of child bearing age are in place and operational, including emergency preparedness and response by the GoSL, UNICEF, and its partners by 2014, which contributes to Child Health, Health And Emergencies, Health Systems Strengthening, Health â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2014, under-fives, children, adolescents and women of child bearing age utilize essential high impact child survival and development services (prevention, treatment and care)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.10 Health, nutrition, WASH and HIV/AIDS policy framework and strategies for children and women of child bearing age are in placeand operational, including emergency preparedness and response by the GoSL, UNICEF, and its partners by 2014
National Strategy for the elimination of mother to child transmission finalized
Infant and Young Child Feeding (IYCF) policy finalized
National environmental health and sanitation policy finalized
Emergency preparedness plan for Child survival interventions in place
Community Health Worker policy finalised and launched
